com.abbyy.mobile.rtr

Interface IRecognitionService

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    IDataCaptureService, ITextCaptureService

    public interface IRecognitionService
    A background recognition service interface.

    How to use:

    1. A single instance of RecognitionService should be created per application (on the UI thread).
    2. Change the recognition language(s) if required (English by default).
    3. Call start when the camera is configured and ready (preferred frame size is 720x1080).
    4. On each call to the Callback.onRequestLatestFrame method, provide a current video frame by calling submitRequestedFrame.
    5. The processing results will be returned through the onFrameProcessed method (called on the UI thread).
    6. Call stop when pausing application or when done.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  IRecognitionService.Callback
      A callback interface to interact with the recognition service: input the data and obtain the results.
      static interface  IRecognitionService.DebugLog
      A callback interface for collecting debug data.
      static interface  IRecognitionService.ExtendedSettings
      Extended service configuration settings.
      static class  IRecognitionService.ResultStabilityStatus
      Stability of the result.
      static class  IRecognitionService.Warning
      A warning that occurred during processing.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        void start(int width,
           int height,
           int orientation,
           android.graphics.Rect areaOfInterest)
        Starts the processing.
        Parameters:
        width - the width of the video frame
        height - the height of the video frame
        orientation - the orientation of the frame in degrees. Should be a multiple of 90.
        areaOfInterest - the area of interest on the frame (for example, it may be selected by the user or highlighted in your application interface)

      • submitRequestedFrame

        void submitRequestedFrame(byte[] buffer)
        Submits the video frame requested through the Callback.onRequestLatestFrame method.
        Parameters:
        buffer - the buffer filled with image data for the latest frame

      • stop

        void stop()
        Stops processing and releases the resources used by the recognition service.

      • setAreaOfInterest

        void setAreaOfInterest(android.graphics.Rect areaOfInterest)
        Sets the area on the frame where the text is to be found.

        By default, no area of interest is selected. The size of the area of interest affects performance and the speed of convergence of the result. The best result is achieved when the area of interest does not touch the boundaries of the frame but has a margin of at least half the size of a typical printed character.

        Parameters:
        areaOfInterest - the rectangle specifying the area of interest

      • setDebugLog

        void setDebugLog(IRecognitionService.DebugLog debugLog)
        Attaches a callback for collecting debug data.

        Used for collecting image data for debugging and tuning the Real-Time Recognition SDK library. The actual collecting and storing is implemented outside the library.

        Parameters:
        debugLog - the object implementing the IRecognitionService.DebugLog interface

      • getExtendedSettings

        IRecognitionService.ExtendedSettings getExtendedSettings()
        Extended service configuration settings. Settings for advanced users. Not used in typical scenarios
        Returns:
        extended service configuration settings
